sen.j: 夏見廃寺（なつみはいじ）とは、三重県名張市夏見にある、飛鳥時代から奈良時代にかけて存在した寺の跡地。
sen.e: Natsumi Haiji (夏見廃寺) is a site of a demolished temple which existed at Natsumi, Nabari City, Mie Prefecture from the Asuka period to the Nara period.
Natsumi Hai-ji is a site of a demolished temple which existed at Natsumi, Nabari City, Mie Prefecture from the Asuka period to the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記削除しました。ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: Natsumi Hai-ji is a site of a demolished temple which existed at Natsumi, Nabari City, Mie Prefecture from the Asuka period to the Nara period.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）3月8日付で国の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: It was designated as a national historic site on March 8, 1990.
It was designated as a national historic site on March 8, 1990.
It was designated as a national historic site on March 8, 1990.

sen.j: かつては雑木林の中であったが現在は名張市中央公園の一部として整備されており、金堂、そして塔と講堂、周囲に掘立柱建物の基壇が保存され、復元展示されている。
sen.e: It was once covered by a copse, but now it is maintained as a part of Nabari City Central Park, and the foundations of Kondo (main hall of a Buddhist temple), To (pagoda), Kodo (lecture hall) and surrounding hottatebashira-tatemono (dug-standing pillar buildings) are preserved, and have been restored and exhibited.

It was once covered by a copse, but now it is maintained as a part of Nabari City Central Park, and the foundations of Kondo (main hall of a Buddhist temple), To (pagoda), Kodo (lecture hall) and surrounding hottatebashira-tatemono (dug-standing pillar buildings) are preserved, and have been restored and exhibited.

It was once covered by a copse, but now it is maintained as a part of Nabari City Central Park, and the foundations of Kondo (main hall of a Buddhist temple), To (pagoda), Kodo (lecture hall) and surrounding hottatebashira-tatemono (dug-standing pillar buildings) are preserved, and have been restored and exhibited.

sen.j: 夏見廃寺の金堂は飛鳥の山田寺と同じ形をしていたことがわかっており、中央政府との結びつきの強さがうかがえるとされている。
sen.e: Kondo of Natsumi Haiji is known to have had the same form as that of Yamada-dera Temple in Asuka, and this is said to imply that it was strongly connected with the central government.
Kondo of Natsumi Hai-ji is known to have had the same form as that of Yamada-dera Temple in Asuka, and this is said to imply that it was strongly connected with the central government.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: Kondo of Natsumi Hai-ji is known to have had the same form as that of Yamada-dera Temple in Asuka, and this is said to imply that it was strongly connected with the central government.

sen.j: 11世紀の初頭に成立した『薬師寺縁起』に、大来皇女の発願により亡き父天武天皇を偲んで伊賀国名張郡に建立された昌福寺のことが書かれており、夏見廃寺はその昌福寺ではないかと考えられている。
sen.e: "Yakushiji Engi" (The History of Yakushi-ji Temple) which was written at the beginning of the 11th century contains a description of Shofuku-ji Temple which was built at the wish of Oku no Himemiko (Princess Oku) in remembrance of her dead father, Emperor Tenmu in Nabari County, Iga Province, and it is supposed that Natsumi Haiji was that Shofuku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「薬師寺」をWeb原稿に合わせて「薬師寺縁起」に訂正しました（リンクを設定されたテキストがその「ヒント」に置き換えられているため）。
sen.e: "Yakushiji Engi" (The History of Yakushi-ji Temple) which was written at the beginning of the 11th century contains a description of Shofuku-ji Temple which was built at the wish of Oku no Himemiko (Princess Oku) in remembrance of her dead father, Emperor Tenmu in Nabari County, Iga Province, and it is supposed that Natsumi Hai-ji was that Shofuku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: "Yakushiji Engi" (The History of Yakushi-ji Temple) which was written at the beginning of the 11th century contains a description of Shofuku-ji Temple which was built at the wish of Oku no Himemiko (Princess Oku) in remembrance of her dead father, Emperor Tenmu in Nabari County, Iga Province, and it is supposed that Natsumi Hai-ji was that Shofuku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 発掘された大形多尊塼仏の須弥壇部分に「甲牛年□□中」（694年）の表記があり、寺の建立についてもこの年の前後とみられている。
sen.e: There is a phrase (甲牛年) that mentions the year 694 written on the Shumidan (a platform or dais for Buddhist image) part of the excavated Ogata-tason-senbutsu (a large clay tile with many Buddha figures), and it is thought that the temple itself was also erected around this year

There is a phrase (甲牛年) that mentions the year 694 written on the Shumidan (a platform or dais for Buddhist image) part of the excavated Ogata-tason-senbutsu (a large clay tile with many Buddha figures), and it is thought that the temple itself was also erected around this year

There is a phrase (甲牛年) that mentions the year 694 written on the Shumidan (a platform or dais for Buddhist image) part of the excavated Ogata-tason-senbutsu (a large clay tile with many Buddha figures), and it is thought that the temple itself was also erected around this year

sen.j: 戦前から地元の人のあいだでは古い瓦があることは知られていたが、終戦後すぐ1946年5月に京都大学考古学教室による発掘調査によって発見された。
sen.e: While since before World War II the local people had known that old roof tiles were scattered around there, immediately after the war, in May, 1946, the ruins of the temple were found through excavation and research by Department of Archaeology, Kyoto University.

While since before World War II the local people had known that old roof tiles were scattered around there, immediately after the war, in May, 1946, the ruins of the temple were found through excavation and research by Department of Archaeology, Kyoto University.

While since before World War II the local people had known that old roof tiles were scattered around there, immediately after the war, in May, 1946, the ruins of the temple were found through excavation and research by Department of Archaeology, Kyoto University.

sen.j: その調査によって10世紀末頃に焼失したことなどが判明している。
sen.e: The research made some facts clear such as that the temple was burnt out around the end of the 10th century.
The research made some facts clear such as that the temple was burnt out around the end of the 10th century.
The research made some facts clear such as that the temple was burnt out around the end of the 10th century.

tit.cmt: ハイフン削除し、表記を統一しました。

sen.j: 夏見廃寺のそばには夏見廃寺展示館があり、夏見廃寺の出土品や、金堂に装飾されていたと伝えられる塼仏の解説や展示などがある。
sen.e: Near Natsumi Haiji stands the Natsumi-Haiji Exhibition Hall, which explains an displays the artifacts of Natsumi Haiji, clay tiles with Buddha figures with which it has been said Kondo was decorated, and so on.

Near Natsumi Hai-ji stands the Natsumi Hai-ji Exhibition Hall, which explains an displays the artifacts of Natsumi Hai-ji, clay tiles with Buddha figures with which it has been said Kondo was decorated, and so on.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除し、表記を統一しました。
sen.e: Near Natsumi Hai-ji stands the Natsumi Hai-ji Exhibition Hall, which explains an displays the artifacts of Natsumi Hai-ji, clay tiles with Buddha figures with which it has been said Kondo was decorated, and so on.
It opened in 1995.
It opened in 1995.
It opened in 1995.

sen.j: 展示館以外の場所は24時間365日立ち入り可能。
sen.e: Visitors can enter anywhere except the Exhibition Hall, any time in a day and any day in a year.
Visitors can enter anywhere except the Exhibition Hall, any time in a day and any day in a year.
Visitors can enter anywhere except the Exhibition Hall, any time in a day and any day in a year.

sen.j: 開館時間：午前9時〜午後5時
sen.e: Hours of opening: 9 A.M. - 5 P.M.
Hours of opening: 9 A.M. - 5 P.M.
Hours of opening: 9 A.M. - 5 P.M.

sen.j: 休館日：月・木曜日、12/28-1/3（但し月・木曜日が祝日にあたるときはその翌日）。
sen.e: The days the Hall is closed: Monday, Thursday, December 28 - January 3 (However, if a national holiday fall on Monday or Thursday, it is closed the next day).
The days the Hall is closed: Monday, Thursday, December 28 - January 3 (However, if a national holiday fall on Monday or Thursday, it is closed the next day).
The days the Hall is closed: Monday, Thursday, December 28 - January 3 (However, if a national holiday fall on Monday or Thursday, it is closed the next day).

sen.j: 夏見廃寺展示館：一般200円、高校生100円、小中学生無料、団体（一般）150円、団体（高校生）無料
sen.e: Natsumi-Haiji Exhibition Hall: Adult \200, Senior high school student \100, Junior high school and Elementary school student Free, Group (Adult) \150, Group (Senior high school student) Free.
Natsumi Hai-ji Exhibition Hall: Adult \200, Senior high school student \100, Junior high school and Elementary school student Free, Group (Adult) \150, Group (Senior high school student) Free.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除し、表記を統一しました。
sen.e: Natsumi Hai-ji Exhibition Hall: Adult \200, Senior high school student \100, Junior high school and Elementary school student Free, Group (Adult) \150, Group (Senior high school student) Free.

sen.j: それ以外の場所：無料
sen.e: The other places: Free.
The other places: Free.
The other places: Free.

sen.j: 位置・交通
sen.e: Location and Access
Location and Access
Location and Access

sen.j: 位置：
sen.e: Location:
Location:
Location:

sen.j: 国道165号線「夏見」もしくは「市役所前」交差点より名張市中央公園へ。
sen.e: From "Natsumi" (夏見) or "Shiyakusho-mae" (市役所前) crossing of National Route 165, for "Nabari City Central Park" (名張市中央公園).
From 'Natsumi' or 'Shiyakusho-mae' crossing of National Route 165, for Nabari City Central Park.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。漢字削除しました。原文に合せて""削除しました。
sen.e: From 'Natsumi' or 'Shiyakusho-mae' crossing of National Route 165, for Nabari City Central Park.

sen.j: 公園内駐車場に駐車可能。
sen.e: The parking area in the park is available.
The parking area in the park is available.
The parking area in the park is available.

sen.j: 公共交通機関の場合は、近鉄大阪線名張駅より徒歩30分、バス利用で「夏見」下車徒歩約10分。
sen.e: If you use public transportation, you walk 30 minutes from Nabari Station of Kintetsu Corporation Osaka Line, or take a bus and get off at "Natsumi" (夏見), and walk 10 minutes.
sen.cmt: Web原稿に合わせてExcel原稿から「近畿日本鉄道」を削除しました。
sen.e: If you use public transportation, you walk 30 minutes from Nabari Station of Kintetsu Corporation Osaka Line, or take a bus and get off at 'Natsumi,' and walk 10 minutes.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
